alert.note: Alert for Guam (Guam) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued April 11 at 5:48AM ChST until April 12 at 6:00AM ChST by NWS Guam
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CHST THIS EVENING... ...HIGH RISK OF RIP CURRENTS THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Large breaking waves of 10 to 12 feet and dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...East facing reefs of the Marianas. * WHEN...High Surf Advisory untilo 6 PM this evening. High Rip Current Risk through tonight. * IMPACTS...Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water.
info.instruction: Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf. Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. Swim in a direction following the shoreline, then head in to shore when you are out of the current.
